objection_handlers.objection: We should be able to handle this internally
objection_handlers.real_concern: Admitting we need help feels like failure or reveals organizational weakness
objection_handlers.authentic_response: The strongest scientific organizations know when to bring in specialized expertise. Your team's time is better spent on core competencies while we handle this specific challenge. Think of us as an extension of your team for this particular need, not a replacement.
objection_handlers.reframe: This is about strategic resource allocation, not capability gaps

objection_handlers.objection: The cost seems high for consulting
objection_handlers.real_concern: Budget constraints and need to justify expense to leadership
objection_handlers.authentic_response: Let's compare this to your alternatives: hiring a full-time specialist at [$150K-$300K] plus 6-month ramp-up time, or the cost of a regulatory delay which typically runs [$500K-$2M] in lost opportunity. Our engagement is scoped to solve your specific problem, then we're done. What's the cost of not solving this correctly?
objection_handlers.reframe: Focus on cost of inaction versus cost of engagement

objection_handlers.objection: We're concerned about confidentiality and IP protection
objection_handlers.real_concern: Legitimate fear of proprietary information leaking to competitors
objection_handlers.authentic_response: This is your most important concern, and it should be. We work under strict NDAs with [specific protections]. Our business model depends entirely on client trust—one breach would destroy our reputation in this small scientific community. We can provide references from [competitors/similar companies] who entrusted us with their most sensitive data. We can also discuss additional protections specific to your situation.
objection_handlers.reframe: Our reputation is our only asset—we protect yours as fiercely as our own

objection_handlers.objection: How do we know you understand our specific [therapeutic area/industry/technology]?
objection_handlers.real_concern: Fear of wasting time educating consultant or getting generic advice
objection_handlers.authentic_response: Fair question. Here's our specific experience: [detailed relevant projects]. But you're right to probe—if we're not the right fit, I'll tell you and refer you to someone who is. Can you describe the specific technical challenge? That will tell us both if we're the right match.
objection_handlers.reframe: Demonstrate specific knowledge, be willing to walk away if not right fit

objection_handlers.objection: We need to think about it / We're still evaluating options
objection_handlers.real_concern: Internal politics, multiple stakeholders, unclear decision process
objection_handlers.authentic_response: Absolutely—this should be a thoughtful decision. Can I ask what specific questions or concerns are still unresolved? Sometimes it helps to identify what information would make you confident moving forward. Also, what's your timeline for making a decision, given [their specific deadline/urgency]?
objection_handlers.reframe: Uncover the real decision-making process and timeline

objection_handlers.objection: We've had bad experiences with consultants before
objection_handlers.real_concern: Previous consultant delivered generic work, missed deadlines, or didn't understand the science
objection_handlers.authentic_response: I hear this often, and I'm sorry you had that experience. What specifically went wrong? [Listen carefully] Here's how we're different: [specific structural differences]. More importantly, let's structure this engagement so you can evaluate our work at [early milestone] before committing to the full scope. You should see value within [specific timeframe] or we haven't earned the rest of the engagement.
objection_handlers.reframe: Acknowledge past pain, offer low-risk proof point

objection_handlers.objection: Can't you just give us a template or train our team instead?
objection_handlers.real_concern: Desire to build internal capability rather than dependency
objection_handlers.authentic_response: That's actually a great long-term strategy. Here's what I'd recommend: let us solve your immediate [problem] while documenting our methodology. We can include knowledge transfer sessions so your team understands the approach. For future similar challenges, you'll have the framework. But right now, you need this solved correctly by [deadline], and learning while doing on a critical project is high-risk.
objection_handlers.reframe: Position as knowledge transfer opportunity, not just service delivery

objection_handlers.objection: We need to see a detailed proposal before we can decide
objection_handlers.real_concern: Want to use your proposal to educate themselves or shop to competitors
objection_handlers.authentic_response: I'm happy to provide a proposal that outlines our approach. To make it genuinely useful to you, I need to understand [2-3 specific technical details]. Can we schedule a deeper technical discussion? That ensures the proposal addresses your actual situation, not a generic template. Some clients find that conversation alone clarifies their needs enough to solve it internally—and that's fine. But if you do need external help, you'll have a proposal that's actually actionable.
objection_handlers.reframe: Require investment from them to get detailed proposal—filters tire-kickers
